title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or translations and to score the response.

One point is awarded for each correctly translated segment. The student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Note: The passage is segmented in such a way as to achieve a balance of easy, medium, and hard segments. Glosses are added to the passage only in order to make a given segment easier, so uncommon words in harder segments will not necessarily be glossed.

Note: The model translation provided below is merely a suggestion of how the passage might accurately be translated. Teachers should use their discretion in accepting alternative translations of any given segment.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately include any of the translations below.

• Segment 1: Illa [that woman, she, Dido]

• Segment 2: graves oculos [heavy eyes]

• Segment 3: conata attollere [having tried, having attempted; to lift, to raise]

• Segment 4: rursus deficit [again; faints, fails]

• Segment 5: sub pectore [beneath; her chest]

• Segment 6: infixum stridit vulnus [driven in, implanted; hisses; the wound]

• Segment 7: Ter sese attollens [three times; herself; lifting, raising]

• Segment 8: cubito -que adnixa [her elbow; and; leaning on, leaning against]

• Segment 9: levavit [she raised]

• Segment 10: ter revoluta toro est [three times; she rolled back; on the couch, on the bed]

• Segment 11: oculis -que errantibus [with (her) eyes, by means of (her eyes; and; wandering]

• Segment 12: alto caelo [high; in the sky,in heaven]

• Segment 13: quaesivit [sought]

• Segment 14: lucem [the light]

• Segment 15: ingemuit -que reperta [groaned; and; with it (the light) having been found, after it (the light) was found, when it was found]
